text:
If the struts-example.war file is place in the webapps directory, the context is
created, but the exception "
javax.servlet.ServletException: Missing message for key index.title" is thrown
when the attempt is made to run the example. The example runs without incident
IF an explicit CLASSPATH inclusion is made to the META-INF/lib/classes directory
for that example.

Since according to the Tomcat documentation, this entry is supposed to be made
automatically on server startup, one can only conclude that either A), there's a
bug in the CLASSPATH setup mechanism, or B) being a typical thick-headed user
who couldn't be bothered to thoroughly read the instructions, some additional
setup was required that wasn't obvious. If case B applies, it would be much
appreciated if the documentation and error reporting mechansism could be
adjuested to be a little more helpful, as the reason I found out it was a
classpath problem was reading about how someone else had cured the same
complaint.

just tested struts generated wars from struts v1.0 version without any problem.

My bet is for configuration problems, perhaps a classpath setted previously 
around.. i dont know..

Fixed in Tomcat 3.2
Fixed in Tomcat 3.3
